greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(x) * psi(x^6) in powers of x where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
Also the number of positive odd solutions to equation x^2 + 6*y^2 = 8*n + 7. - _Seiichi Manyama_, May 28 2017
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-7/8) * eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^12)^2 / (eta(q) * eta(q^6)) in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, x^(1/2)] EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, x^3] / (4 q^(7/8)), {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^12 + A)^2 / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^6 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 07 2015
